titleStmt.title: The French Printer to the Reader.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The French Printer to the Reader.

monogr.title: Newes from France : containing tvvo declarations of two new conuerts from the Church of Rome to the reformed churches of France: the former made by Master M. du Tertrf [sic], Lord de la Motthe Luyne, late preacher amongst the order of the Capucins vnder the name of F. Firmin, &c. at Saumur on the 27. of May last: the latter by the Marquise Boniuet, Lord of Creuecoeur, &c. at Rochell on the seuenth of August last. Both translated out of the seuerall French copies into English by E.M. of Christ-Church in Oxford. Whereunto is added an English letter sent from Pari by an English gentleman to his friend in England, touching the late surprisall and imprisonment of the Prince of Conde, which happened on the 22. of August last

div.head: The French Printer to the Reader.
div.p: BEcause that otherwise this page had beene left emptie, I haue thought good to set in it the Epitaph of the late Lord of BONIVET, Admirall of France, as I haue found it in Du-Bellay.

lg.l: LA France & le Piémont, & les Cieux, & les arts,
Les Soláats, & le Monde out faict comme six parts
De ce grand Boniuet: Car vne si grand chose
Dedans vn seul tembeau ne pouuoit estre enclose.
La France en a le corps qú elle auoit esleué,
Le Piémont a le coeur qú il auoit esprouuē,
Les Cieux en out l' esprit, & les Arts la memoire,
Les Soldats le regret, & le Monde la Gloire.

div.p: The English whereof is the very same which wee finde to be the Epitaph made vpon the death of our Country-man the noble and thrice-worthy Knight Sir Philip Sidney: and therefore I haue thought good to leaue it as it was (mutatis mutandis) the names onely altered.

lg.l: FRANCE and PIEMONT, the Heauens, and the Arts,
The Souldiers, and the World, haue made sixe parts
Of noble BONIVET, for none will suppose
That a small heape of stones can BONIVET inclose.
His body FRANCE hath had, for she it fed;
And PIEMONT his bloud in her defence shed:
The Heauens haue his soule, the Arts haue his fame,
All Souldiers the griefe, the World his good name.
